result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mikell Breedlove Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mikell Breedlove Johnson in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Mikell Breedlove Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk for Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests adjourned scheduling hearing.  Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling Conference set for 10/10/2022 at 8:30 am has been rescheduled to 10/17/2022 at 8:30 a.m.  Matter was originally set on Jury Trial week.

Defendant Mikell Breedlove Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Galaviz appeared by video for Mikell Breedlove Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge VanGrunsven Branch 09.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mikell Breedlove Johnson in court with Attorney Peter M Wolff; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Wolff is newly retained and needs time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 069754,
Payable Number: 1021781,
Receipt Number: 22RP029860,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Mikell Breedlove Johnson in court, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mikell Breedlove Johnson in court appear in person.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant previously posted $5000 cash bail. Court orders the cash bail be returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Mikell Breedlove Johnson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@01:00pm
